title: RtGithub fails to connect when behind a proxy.
body:
Sometimes, I am working on the project on a network that is behind a proxy (such as the University library). In those occasions, the integration tests fail to connect and throws UnknownHostException:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1917892/1867507/a69ad784-7850-11e3-8a19-cd22fcac0271.png)

However, I found that when I change the initialization of RtGithub.REQUEST to an instance of JdkRequest instead of ApacheRequest as it is now, everything works fine:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1917892/1867537/3bc5ce7c-7851-11e3-854d-0fa30b041126.png)

I am changing the proxy settings by using the following JVM arguments:

```
-Dhttp.proxyHost
-Dhttp.proxyPort
-Dhttps.proxyHost
-Dhttps.proxyPort
```

My thinking is that this is a bug because a) it works with one type of Request object but not the other, and b) there would definitely be instances where our users would be needing to access Github from behind a proxy.

Is there any difference between JdkRequest and ApacheRequest that would cause the latter to fail when behind a proxy? And is there any particular reason why we are using ApacheRequest by default instead of JdkRequest?

I am working on a machine running Windows 7, and using the Java JDK 7 update 7. The test was run under Eclipse 4.3 SR1 (Kepler).
